Complete Sequence.schema:description: To be considered complete, the procedure used for library construction MUST generate sequences that 1) include the first V segment codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e. after the leader sequence) and 2) include the last complete codon of the J segment (i.e. 1 bp 5' of the J->C splice site) and 3) provide sequence information for all positions between 1) and 2). To be considered complete & untemplated, the sections of the sequences defined in points 1) to 3) of the previous sentence MUST be untemplated, i.e. MUST NOT overlap with the primers used in library preparation. (Examples: partial, complete, or complete & untemplated)
Complete Sequence.schema:name: Complete Sequence
Complete Sequence.description: Complete Sequence field schema autogenerated by the CEDAR Template Editor 1.4.3-SNAPSHOT
Complete Sequence.title: Complete Sequence field schema
